com.indooratlas.android

Interface IndoorAtlas


  • public interface IndoorAtlas
    IndoorAtlas is the public interface of IndoorAtlas API. IndoorAtlas interface is used to fire API actions, the results of which are informed through the callbacks on the IndoorAtlasListener interface.
    Since:
    0.5
    Version:
    0.5

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • startPositioning

        void startPositioning(java.lang.String buildingId,
                    java.lang.String levelId,
                    java.lang.String floorplanId)
                      throws IndoorAtlasException
        Starts a new positioning session.

        onServiceInitializing is called on IndoorAtlasListener right away, if initializing is started.

        onServiceInitialized is called on IndoorAtlasListener after a successful session initialization.

        onInitializationFailed is called on IndoorAtlasListener after an unsuccessful session initialization.

        Throws IndoorAtlasException when startPositioning is called, and calibration is not yet ready. Note that when IndoorAtlasException is thrown it indicates that at the same time calibration state information is provided through frequent callbacks on onCalibrationStatus() on IndoorAtlasListener. In a typical application, this exception entails the need to perform intentional calibration movement and wait for callback on onCalibrationReady on IndoorAtlasListener.
        Throws:
        IndoorAtlasException

      • startPositioning

        void startPositioning(java.lang.String buildingId,
                    java.lang.String levelId,
                    java.lang.String floorplanId,
                    PositionerParameters positionerParameters)
                      throws IndoorAtlasException
        Starts a new positioning session with custom parameters.

        Throws:
        IndoorAtlasException

      • stopPositioning

        void stopPositioning()
        Tears down the positioning session. After tear down, a callback is made to onServiceStopped of the associated IndoorAtlasListener.

      • setPreferMobileConnection

        void setPreferMobileConnection(boolean preferMobile)
        Set network preference to mobile hipri connection. This is also the default, if mobile hipri network is available on the platform. ononNetworkChangeComplete is called on IndoorAtlasListener to inform about the result.

        Parameters:
        preferMobile - when true, sets network preference to mobile hipri connection, if mobile hipri network is available on the platform.

        When false, sets network preference to WiFi, even if Wifi network is not available.

      • tearDown

        void tearDown()
        Tear down. Releases any resources used by the API.

      • isCalibrationReady

        boolean isCalibrationReady()
        Query interface for calibration state. If it returns true, more movement of the device is required in order to finish calibration. Note that when isCalibrationReady() returns false it means that at the same time calibration state information is provided through frequent callbacks on onCalibrationStatus() of IndoorAtlasListener.
        Returns:
        true, if calibration is required. False if calibration is ready.

      • getCommunicationLatency

        float getCommunicationLatency()
        Query interface for approximate communication latency.
        Returns:
        current communication latency in seconds.

      • getBufferedQueueLength

        int getBufferedQueueLength()
        Query interface for getting number of queued sensor data packets.
        Returns:
        current amount of buffered messages. Returns -1 if there is no active positioning session.
